Code of conduct for the board documented and monitored
Acceptance of duties and obligations form signed by each board member
Conflicts of interest-Declaration of financial and other interests completed annually by board
Recommended percentage of independent board members appointed (50%)
Credentials of independent board members verified with regulatory authorities
Sub-committees appointed to advise board on risks and controls
Formal induction training programme in place for new board members
Formal ongoing education programme in place for board members
Board Assessment and Breach of Code of Conduct
Formal annual performance appraisal in place for the board, the principal officer and sub-committees
Breach of Code of Conduct procedure in place
Internal controls and procedures clearly documented and monitored
Third party service provider service level agreements signed and monitored
Regular reviews of services, fees and operational costs of the Fund
Information systems and security policies monitored and reviewed
Actual, potential or perceived conflicts of interest monitored
Regular reviews of compliance with regulatory and statutory requirements
Mechanisms in place to ensure expert advice is independently given
Expert advisors appointed directly by the board
Risk management policy documented and reviewed annually
Fidelity cover in place to indemnify fund
Personal Indemnity cover in place to indemnify board members
Third party service providers have professional indemnity and fidelity guarantee insurance cover
Investment Performance of the Fund Assets
Clearly defined mandates agreed between the board and investment managers
Investment Policy Statement documented, communicated to stakeholders and reviewed annually
Investment portfolios regularly reviewed by board to ensure they are appropriate for the membership profile
Procedures documented and followed ensuring rights of members are protected when assets are transferred
Stakeholder Relationships, Communication and Access to Information
Policy in place to ensure confidentiality and ownership of information
Communication policy in place to ensure members and beneficiaries have access to appropriate information
Members and Beneficiaries effectively communicated to and rights protected

Policy in place for appointment, communication and monitoring of Service Providers
Requirements of Regulatory Authority complied with and queries dealt with expiditiously
